001package io.github.ai4ci;
002
003import java.io.IOException;
004import java.nio.file.Files;
005import java.nio.file.Path;
006
007import org.apache.logging.log4j.Level;
008import org.apache.logging.log4j.core.Layout;
009import org.apache.logging.log4j.core.appender.ConsoleAppender;
010import org.apache.logging.log4j.core.appender.FileAppender;
011import org.apache.logging.log4j.core.config.Configurator;
012import org.apache.logging.log4j.core.config.NullConfiguration;
013import org.apache.logging.log4j.core.layout.PatternLayout;
014
015import io.github.ai4ci.config.ExperimentConfiguration;
016
017/**
018 * Logging setup helper that adapts the logging sinks depending on whether the
019 * simulator is running inside a SLURM batch job or interactively.
020 *
021 * <p>
022 * Rationale for routing logging to console when running under SLURM:
023 * <ul>
024 * <li>SLURM captures and manages the stdout/stderr streams for each job/task
025 * and stores them in job-specific files (e.g. <code>slurm-{jobid}.out</code>).
026 * Writing to the console ensures that a single canonical per-task log file is
027 * produced by the scheduler rather than having several processes write
028 * concurrently to a shared log file on a network filesystem.</li>
029 * <li>Using console output avoids contention and atomicity issues that can
030 * arise when multiple parallel tasks attempt to append to the same file (which
031 * may be on NFS), and reduces the need for additional file locking logic inside
032 * the application.</li>
033 * <li>Scheduler-captured logs are easier to aggregate, view, and associate with
034 * a particular job or array task when debugging or post-processing. It also
035 * preserves SLURM-provided job metadata (timestamps, job id) together with the
036 * application output.</li>
037 * <li>When running interactively (not under SLURM), a file appender is created
038 * so logs are written to a consistent location inside the experiment
039 * <code>batchDirectory</code>. This makes it easy to inspect logs from local
040 * development runs.</li>
041 * </ul>
042 *
043 * <p>
044 * Behaviour summary:
045 * <ul>
046 * <li>If <code>cfg.getBatchConfig().isSlurmBatch()</code> is true, the logger
047 * configures a console appender only; SLURM (or whatever batch system is in
048 * use) is expected to capture that output into its per-job files.</li>
049 * <li>If not running under a SLURM batch, a FileAppender is also created and an
050 * existing <code>jpansim2.log</code> file in the batch directory is removed
051 * before starting to keep local runs tidy.</li>
052 * </ul>
053 */
054public class SlurmAwareLogger {
055
056        /**
057         * Configure logging for the experiment run.
058         *
059         * <p>
060         * This method creates a <b>console</b> appender in all cases and will add a
061         * <b>file</b> appender only when
062         * <code>cfg.getBatchConfig().isSlurmBatch()</code> is false. The console
063         * appender is intentionally used when running under SLURM so that the
064         * scheduler can capture the complete per-task output in its job files. See
065         * class-level Javadoc for rationale.
066         *
067         * @param cfg           the experiment configuration (used to determine batch
068         *                      mode and names)
069         * @param baseDirectory the experiment base/batch directory where local logs
070         *                      are written
071         * @param console       the log level to use for the console appender
072         * @param file          the log level to use for the file appender (only used
073         *                      when not running under SLURM)
074         */
075        public static void setupLogger(
076                        ExperimentConfiguration cfg, Path baseDirectory, Level console,
077                        Level file
078        ) {
079
080                var batchDirectory = cfg.getBatchDirectoryPath(baseDirectory);
081
082                var ctx = Configurator.initialize(new NullConfiguration());
083                var config = ctx.getConfiguration();
084                config.getAppenders().forEach(
085                                (key, value) -> config.getRootLogger()
086                                                .removeAppender(value.getName())
087                );
088
089                var pattern = String.format(
090                                "%%d{yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss.SSS} [%s] [%%-5level] %%msg%%n",
091                                cfg.getBatchConfig().getBatchName()
092                );
093
094                Layout<?> layout = PatternLayout.newBuilder().withPattern(pattern)
095                                .withConfiguration(config).build();
096
097                // Console Appender â€” always configured; SLURM captures stdout/stderr
098                var consoleAppender = ConsoleAppender.newBuilder()
099                                .setName("ConsoleAppender").setLayout(layout).build();
100
101                consoleAppender.start();
102                config.addAppender(consoleAppender);
103
104                var rootLogger = config.getLoggerConfig(
105                                org.apache.logging.log4j.LogManager.ROOT_LOGGER_NAME
106                );
107                rootLogger.setLevel(Level.DEBUG);
108                rootLogger.addAppender(consoleAppender, console, null);
109
110                if (!cfg.getBatchConfig().isSlurmBatch()) {
111
112                        // File Appender only if SLURM not running otherwise console output
113                        // is directed to file by SLURM. Writing a local per-run file is useful
114                        // for interactive development and reproducible local debugging.
115
116                        var logFileName = batchDirectory.resolve("jpansim2.log").toString();
117                        try {
118                                Files.deleteIfExists(batchDirectory.resolve("jpansim2.log"));
119                        } catch (IOException e) {
120                                System.out
121                                                .println("Problem deleting old log files: " + e.getMessage());
122                        }
123
124                        var fileAppender = FileAppender.newBuilder().withFileName(logFileName)
125                                        .setName("FileAppender").setLayout(layout).build();
126
127                        fileAppender.start();
128                        config.addAppender(fileAppender);
129                        rootLogger.addAppender(fileAppender, file, null);
130                }
131
132                ctx.updateLoggers();
133        }
134}
